metadata.title: Recurrence of positive SARS-CoV-2 RNA in COVID-19: A case report
metadata.abstract: The ongoing outbreak of COVID-19 that began in Wuhan, China, has constituted a Public Health Emergency of International Concern, with cases confirmed in multiple countries. Currently patients are the main source of infection. We report a confirmed case of COVID-19 whose oropharyngeal swab test of SARS-CoV-2 RNA turned positive in convalescence. This case highlights the importance of dynamic surveillance of SARS-CoV-2 RNA for infectivity assessment.
metadata.author: Dabiao Chen, Wenxiong Xu, Ziying Lei, Zhanlian Huang, Jing Liu, Zhiliang Gao, Liang Peng

introduction: The ongoing outbreak of COVID-19 that began in Wuhan, China, has constituted a Public Health Emergency of International Concern, with cases confirmed in multiple countries. Currently patients are the main source of infection. We report a confirmed case of COVID-19 whose oropharyngeal swab test of SARS-CoV-2 RNA turned positive in convalescence. This case highlights the importance of dynamic surveillance of SARS-CoV-2 RNA for infectivity assessment.

Abstract: The ongoing outbreak of COVID-19 that began in Wuhan, China, has constituted a Public Health Emergency of International Concern, with cases confirmed in multiple countries. Currently patients are the main source of infection. We report a confirmed case of COVID-19 whose oropharyngeal swab test of SARS-CoV-2 RNA turned positive in convalescence. This case highlights the importance of dynamic surveillance of SARS-CoV-2 RNA for infectivity assessment.

summary: The ongoing outbreak of COVID-19 that began in Wuhan, China, has constituted a Public Health Emergency of International Concern, with cases confirmed in multiple countries.
People with positive SARS-CoV-2 RNA of respiratory tract specimen are infectious source of COVID-19.
SARS-CoV-2 RNA of respiratory tract specimen may be persistent or recurrent positive during the course.
Dynamic surveillance of SARS-CoV-2 RNA should be performed for infectivity assessment.
Patients are the main source of infection.
The authors report a confirmed case of COVID-19 whose oropharyngeal swab test of SARS-CoV-2 RNA turned positive in convalescence.
This case highlights the importance of dynamic surveillance of SARS-CoV-2 RNA for infectivity assessment.

Introduction: The ongoing outbreak of COVID-19 that began in Wuhan, China, has constituted a Public Health Emergency of International Concern, with cases confirmed in multiple countries.
Results: People with positive SARS-CoV-2 RNA of respiratory tract specimen are infectious source of COVID-19.
SARS-CoV-2 RNA of respiratory tract specimen may be persistent or recurrent positive during the course.
Dynamic surveillance of SARS-CoV-2 RNA should be performed for infectivity assessment.
Patients are the main source of infection.
The authors report a confirmed case of COVID-19 whose oropharyngeal swab test of SARS-CoV-2 RNA turned positive in convalescence.
Conclusion: This case highlights the importance of dynamic surveillance of SARS-CoV-2 RNA for infectivity assessment.
